The North Karelia Youth Project: Evaluation of Two
Years of Intervention on Health Behavior and CVD Risk
Factors among 13- to 15-Year Old Children'
JUKKA T. SALONEN,t PIRJO POYHIA,t KAJ KOSKELA,t AND
"National Public Health Institute, Department of Epidemiology, Mannerheimintie 166,
00280 Helsinki 28, Finland, tUniversity of Kuopio, Research Institute of Public Health,
PL 40, 70101 Kuopio 10, Finland. and +Harvard School of Public Health, Department
A school and community based intervention to influence health behavior and cardiovas-
cular disease (CVD) risk factors in 13- to 15-year-old children was carried out in North
Karelia, Finland. The intervention was carried out on two leveis: (a) an intensive interven-
tion (II) in two schools and (b) a county-wide intervention (CI) in the rest of North Karelia,
For the evaluation three matched pairs of schools were chosen: the two schools of the II,
two schools to represent the CI and two schools from a reference county (R). 851 children,
their parents, and their teachers were studied at the outset in 1978: and after the intervention
in 1980. During the program the proportion of boys reporting to smoke atl least 1-21 times per
month increased 12.6% in II, 8.2% in CI and 29.7% in the R schools (P < 0.001 between II
and R) and in giris 9.0%, 18.0% and 20.0%, respectively. (P < 0.05 between II and R). The
mean serum total cholesterol was 5.1 mmol/liter in 1978 and it decreased among boys 0.5
mmolliter: in all three school groups. Among girls. the decrease was 0.43 mmolliter (II), 0.35
mmolliter (CI), and 0.21 mmol/liter (R) (P < 0.01 between. II and R). The mean: amount of fat
from milk and butter changed among boys -8 g (II), Og (CI), and +3 g (R) and among girls
-168. -2g, and -Sg,respectively (both P: < 0.011 between. II and R). Thei intervention had no
effect on blood pressure although there was some reported reduction in the salt consump-
tion in the intervention schools. A relative decrease according to the intervention level was ob-
served: among North Karelian children in occurrence of psychosomatic symptoms. The effects
were not related to increases in bealth knowledge or changes in attitudes and did not lead, on
Cardiovascular diseases (CVD) are the major, singular public health problem in
most of the industrial worid, but especially in Finland (6, 11). A number of pro-
spective studies have indicated that possibilities for CVD prevention lie in reduc-
tion of well established risk factors: smoking, elevated serum cholesterol, and
hypertension (6, 18, 22). Several preventive trials among adults are under way to
test the hypothesis that risk factor reduction in the population will lead to: reduced
mortality and morbidity from CVD (17, 25, 29). Data from the North Karelia
project have indicated that an innovative community-based program can lead to a
This work has been aided by grants from the Finnish National Board of Health and National

SUBJECT: FULL MARGIN COMPETITIVE COUPON ACTIVITY

Attached is the latest competitive supermarket coupon information through March 24,
1991) as reported by various data sources. Note: Media-delivered couponing
information as reported by the Advertising Checking Bureau is currently available

through February.
SUMMARY

RJR reduced the overall level of coupon support behind their Full Margin brands.
This shift was driven by reductions in on-carton/in-store couponing.
Philip Morris' Full Margin couponing increased versus a year-ago due to the various
Fourth Quarter 1990 Direct Mail programs for Marlboro, Merit and Benson & Hedges.
Lorillard significantly increased coupon support behind Newport, Kent and True.
Importantly, this higher value coupon activity has had a positive impact on the
brands' share pertormance in the supermarket trade class (as reported by the
InfoScan Rapid Fact data base). In addition, Lorillard is using a new coupon delivery
system: Register Receipt Coupons which delivers $5.00 coupons for Newport to
American and Brown & Williamson are focusing their couponing efforts behind their
Price Value/Sub-Generic brands and have consequently reduced support for the

consumers at retail.

manufacturers' Full Margin businesses.

HIGHLIGHTS

supermarket Full Margin couponing trends continue to be driven primarily by R.J.
Reynolds (40% of volume sold on coupon) and Lorillard's recent emphasis behind
their Full Margin brands (37% of volume) for the four-week period ending March
24th. However, note that RJR'S Full Margin couponing has lost momentum during
First Quarter 1991. Full Margin's percent volume sold on coupon for the
manufacturer is down from a high of 51% at the end of 1990 to its current level of
40%. Price Value couponing for R.J. Reynolds remained stable at around 62%
Couponing for RJR's Full Margin brands declined primarily as a result of decreasing
in-store/on-carton coupon activity. For the most current four-week period, the percent
of stores with on-carton couponing for Winston decreased -24 points to 14% versus
the prior period; Salem, -27 points to 16%; Camel, -27 points to 17%; and Vantage,
With the exception of Camel, however, Full Margin coupon activity supported by
media-delivered programs) for Winston (42% of volume sold on coupon), Salem
(45%) and Vantage (57%) remained high relative to the industry average. Camel
experienced a significant decline in volume sold on coupon (-16 points to only 19%) 6
due in part to reductions after the introductory support behind Ultra Lights.
Additionally, it is likely that RJR is reducing the level of in-store/on-carton couponing %
behind the brand to refocus support to Camel on pack sales in Convenience Outlets.

Despite our experience in the proposed field of investigation, numerous aspects of the
structure and function of the puimonary lyaphatics are still either largely unknown or a
matter of considerable controversy in the literature. Each technique of study having its
shortcomings, these can only be solved accurately by a further and multidisciplinary in-
vestigation of the pulmonary lymphatics which vill include various techniques, i.e.
anatomical injection studies, stereomicroscopical studies, serial reconstructions,
radiography and microradiography, - histological techniques, - morphometrical techniques,
histochemical techniques, transmission electron microscopy, - freeze-etching electron
During the three years of this research proposal ve intend to study the pulmonary lympha-
tics - with the techniques proposed along three major lines of investigation : (1)
normal morphology of the pulmonary lymphatics, (2) an experimental study of the various
morphological factors involved in the clearance and lymphatic drainage of the lung paren-
chyma, (3) and morphological studies of the lung lymphatics in various pathological con-
ditions especially in such cases where the formation of lung edena is observed (e.g. neo-,
natal lungs : hyaline membrane disease : adult lungs : pulmonary edema, especially when
associated with chronic respiratory insufficiency as in chronic bronchitis or emphysema,
shock lungs (cardiogenic and neurogenic), uremia, drouning...). Though the lines of investi-
gation are distinet, the study object (i.e. the lymphatics) is identical and the results
These studies will necessarily end in ieportant and original contributions which will
have many basic and appliedi results in the structure and function of the normal and
diseased lung. It is obvious that these studies are of immediate and relevant importance

The concept behind thls program, sponsored by Virginia Polytechnic
Institute in collaboration with the NSF, the Naval Ordnance Laboratory,
and Department of Defense laboratorles, is to bring technology to industry
simllar to the very successful transfer that has been effected In agriculture.
